website_summaries.verdict: A high-quality mechanical keyboard that is pricey but has features that are worth the extra cost.
pros: A lightweight mechanical keyboard that is still sturdy and comfortable to type on
Includes a volume roller ball, programmable multicolor backlighting, a detachable wrist rest with 2 different surfaces, and 6 programmable macro keys
cons: The programming software can be a little hard to understand

customer_reviews.title: Stunning Looking KB
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Just Absolutely Stunning High quality feel/build (heavy quality feel) Amazing Keys/switches. Cons: Cherry switches too good. Took a bit of adjusting to this KB coming from Cherry Blues. Anymore than resting your hands on the keyboard during gaming and you might start randomly strafing/jumping/crouching/switching weapons or whatever else. The con above is really a pro once you get used to it. The Only True Con: Productivity. It is simply way too sensitive to write documents/code without randomly letters popping up all over the place as the slightest pressure actuates the key.
customer_reviews.author: Lawrence Chung

customer_reviews.title: the corsair iCUE Software causes system performance issues.
customer_reviews.text: the corsair iCUE Software causes system performance issues. i have submitted numerous technical support cases to corsair about who was soon as their ICUE software is installed my internet speed drops form 900 to 200 mbps with no response. iCUE Software is poorly witten, UI is not friendly and it is a strain on system resources, AVOID corsair "iCUE enabled" products.
customer_reviews.author: koman90

customer_reviews.title: OMG
customer_reviews.text: OMG. This keyboard has everything a gamer wants. The look and the built quality is amazing. The feel and responsiveness of the Cherry MX Speed keys is just perfect. Love the wrist rest. Also a big plus is the texture on the additional gaming key caps. The grip is just so much better compared to blank caps. I could go on... I have owned and tested quite a few gaming keyboards, from all kind of brands, like LogiTech, Razer... For me this is the best gaming keyboard that is currently available.
customer_reviews.author: Dirk Fischer

customer_reviews.title: Beware of product reliability or lack thereof
customer_reviews.text: Keyboard died after about 3 to 4 months of use. Totally died...no functionality and no lights, and resetting did not work. Dealing with a warranty request for replacement. Previously had a Logitech G15 that lasted like 15 years, but finally one of the keys stopped clicking. Did research on getting a new keyboard and this Corsair rated highly, but those reviewers don't use them long enough to probably test for reliability, just for features.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Great keyboard, unless fluids come near it
customer_reviews.text: I really liked this keyboard, and it's really programmable. The lights are great on it, there isn't much it can't do, except don't let fluids of any sort touch it. A little bit of tea, one time, took mine out really fast. It was probably partly my fault it died so fast, because I didn't unplug it right away, thinking it's some super keyboard with really good water-resistance. The liquid went right through the keys, directly into the circuit board with little resistance. I may buy another one, because I just like the keyboard, but I'm hesitant.
customer_reviews.author: Threehawks

customer_reviews.title: Super Nice
customer_reviews.text: Every thing about this keyboard screams high quality. The lighting is bright, unbelievably customize-able, easy to read, and has every feature I could want in a keyboard. Wrist rest feels good, keys feel good, and comes with a lot of textured keys for custom gaming grip. For gaming, this is such a great keyboard, because the keys are easy to actuate, but for me that is a bit of drawback for typing. It's not Corsair's fault, but these keys are so easy to hit, I end up making a lot of typing mistakes. I should have gotten switches that required slightly more force to actuate, but your mileage may vary.
customer_reviews.author: Joel

customer_reviews.title: american company, made in china
customer_reviews.text: coursair. i have bought many things from you. only memory that goes into my computer. to find that your stuff is made in china is a deal breaker. the keyboard is terrible. the keys come off easily. you can only control the color schemes by the icue software. i do not want another bloatware on my system. 150 for a keyboard. better have onboard controls. aluminum at the bottom of the keyboard. but no protection what so ever for the keys. the average keyboard has their keys recessed, this keyboard has the entire key unprotected. terrible design. terrible implementation. and worse of all its made in china
customer_reviews.author: doreen

customer_reviews.title: Perfect keyboard, ok software.
customer_reviews.text: Love this keyboard, and happy it was my first leap into going mechanical. The feedback is excellent and so satisfying. Lights are bright and beyond customizable. Having multiple brightness settings is a great feature. Everything feels quality. I only knocked off a star because the software is poor. Not intuitive, and often gets laggy when responding to keyboard commands. e.e. taking several seconds to respond to clicking the brightness button, or crashing out altogether.
customer_reviews.author: Ross

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for someone that games but also types a lot....
customer_reviews.text: This is the best keyboard I've ever owned. I love the flexibility to set macro keys to do a myriad of tasks. Love the Brown keys as they are the perfect hybrid. This thing is built like a tank, super comfortable and I'm typing faster than ever. Oh yeah, It has all kinds of lights if you care about that. I don't, but it does so many different lighting patterns in every color, so it should be mentioned. This thing sits in place, doesn't slide. I can't go back, it's a lot for a keyboard, but worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: Rachael Laufenberg

customer_reviews.title: It is great, but i got one with a problem, and was able to fix it fortunately
customer_reviews.text: It is a great keyboard, but unfortunately mine had an issue with the (L) switch that doesn't work unless i hard press it and twist it too, I talked to Amazon Support and i got a partial refund, since I didn't want to return it,Because it is too much of a hassle to do since I am an international customer. Any way later I decided to open the keyboard and check why it the key wasn't working, fortunately i was able to fix since the problem was be ause of incorrect soldering where one of the switch pins was bent under the board. Now it is working fine.😀
customer_reviews.author: Mohammed H Al-Jasim

customer_reviews.title: Left macro keys made it hard to use for me
customer_reviews.text: As there is an extra column of keys on the left, I kept pressing them instead of the ESC, TAB, CapsLock, and so on. I couldn't get used to it so I ended up returning it and ordering the K70, which is just like the K95 but without those extra keys.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: RGB for individual keys, works
customer_reviews.text: Keeping this short. Received it with several keys ajar.(pics). Had to use another keyboard to figure out where they went. Box was undamaged, so likely from rough shipping and handling. Found a video to figure out per-key RGB. The keyboard is noticeably heavy and has less optional gaming keys than my old SteelSeries Apex Gaming Keyboard it replaces. The "dual" function keyboard keys are displayed opposite of a standard typing keyboard, so it'll take getting use to. It doesn't blow me away, but I wanted a quality keyboard. It'll do.
customer_reviews.author: Scotty

customer_reviews.title: Quality
customer_reviews.text: This keyboard is great. I got the Brown MX and it feels great typing and playing games is perfect with it. I mainly play Overwatch, League of Legends, and World of Warcraft. Having the extra programmable buttons on the left hand side makes everything much more efficient. The iCUE program is a bit difficult to get around (but I'm learning), other than that this is a solid product. Bit pricey, but if you're looking for a keyboard to be your last keyboard for awhile, this one would be it for me. I also got the white textured key caps from Corsair which makes the keyboard all the more impressive!
customer_reviews.author: Naga

customer_reviews.title: Good keyboard, buy only at a discount
customer_reviews.text: + I like the hair-trigger switch and it does make a different in winning or losing the game at high level game play (I play a lot of SC2, DOTA and LoL). +The macro keys are convenient for me to do the work too. I bought this because I need the macro keys to finish some of my work faster. - The USB pass through port is useless. It's broken on day 1, but since I don't have the need to use it, I don't see the need to return the keyboard. - It's almost 2 weeks and I already see the trend of the keys register multiple input.
customer_reviews.author: Khoi Dang

customer_reviews.title: Great overall, but keys come off easily.
customer_reviews.text: I like this keyboard. The feel is great and I was able to get used to it fairly quickly. The only issues I have were that the keys can come off pretty easily if you're pressing aggressively at all and that it didn't come with a wrist rest. A little disappointed there so I returned for now. Also, the board itself is pretty bulky so make sure you have space to work with. Dealing with icue software can be a bit of a pain at times, but it worked. I ordered this on a whim and I think I'll buy another one soon. For now, I can still use my old board.
customer_reviews.author: Jenn

customer_reviews.title: Excellent build and function
customer_reviews.text: Very nice keyboard. I rarely game, and don't really care all that much about the spiffy glowy keys and RGB patterns, but I do type all day (I've published 18 books) and wanted a solid, mechanical keyboard with quiet(ish), smooth keys. The layout is excellent, program-ability is great, but most importantly it's solidly built and reliable. And, I certainly don't mind that it looks cool too.
customer_reviews.author: L. A. Kane

customer_reviews.title: Was this ever a mistake!
customer_reviews.text: I found the pulsating color changing back light to be annoying and figured there had to be a way to make it steady. I won't be taking the time to find out how to do that because I won't continue to use this keyboard. A major nuisance is the fact that the characters normally found positioned above the numbers on the key caps !@#$%^&*() [and a few other keys] are displayed below the unshifted values. The designer should have been tared and feathered! --- but that only dropped it to 3 stars. The real problem is the space bar. If you depress either end it does not register. My typingisallruntogether!!! Pick another keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: Jon Lusk

customer_reviews.title: Nice gaming keyboard, but a little too much play in keys
customer_reviews.text: I decided to upgrade my Logitech Orion G610 (Brown) mechanical keyboard for a more programmable one with macro keys and RGB lighting (not strictly required). While it's a nice keyboard with some premium touches -- per-key RGB, metal base, etc. -- there's significantly more play in these keys than in the G610 I've been using. If I could find another deal on a brown G610, I would prefer to have that instead. Still, it's a nice keyboard, but I don't know it was worth the extra money I spent over my old G610.
customer_reviews.author: Tech Savvy

customer_reviews.title: Stopped Working Before 30 Days!
customer_reviews.text: The keyboard was everything as expected when I first got it. All the switches worked perfectly and the design went great with my PC. RGB was very nice and bright as well. All was good until one day while typing something, some of the keys suddenly stopped activating or starting activating on their own. Because of this happening within 30 days, I just returned it. This could have been the case of just one faulty product and I would be willing to give Corsair another shot as long as I know I am still protected with Amazon’s buyer protection policies.
customer_reviews.author: MathO24

customer_reviews.title: Solid, but I wouldn't call it "quiet".
customer_reviews.text: Quality keyboard overall. RGB is good, construction is solid, I liked that the wrist rest had a reversible rubber surface for concave and grippy on one side or convex and smooth on the other. Also liked the provided replacement keys with the textured surfaces and raised edges for WASD controls. Definitely makes it more comfortable to use when gaming. Only downside for me would be that this is considered the "quiet" version, and it's not "quiet" at all. Maybe VERY slightly less loud compared to the louder cherry keys you typically get, but by no means is it quiet, so temper expectations if that's a key point for you. Other than that, though, absolutely solid keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: Bradums

customer_reviews.title: loses key bindings, cliche pretty features crap basic function
customer_reviews.text: hideous convoluted app to control stupid lighting, keys get all messed up and keyboard is hard to reset unless your PC is on top of your desk to unplug cable while pressing buttons on keyboard. F keys on mine all messed up, trying to fix but for the cost, WTF? thinking of returning, its not even close to worth the cost to have lights that are trivial and soon are just ignored and have keys that dont work. The key press is nice but the stupid app one must use is awful.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth M Hatch

customer_reviews.title: This Keyboard is garbage
customer_reviews.text: I had high hopes for this keyboard, specifically looking for better/faster response in ARPG games. Sadly, this was not the case for this keyboard. The key spacing is odd making it hard to get used to. This keyboard also drops key-presses making me skip attacks when gaming. I went back to a crappy Dell membrane keyboard that works way better thank this PoS. Save you $$$ and buy something else that actually works. Also had a Corsair Mouse and it was garbage too. Buy their memory and power supplies pass on everything else.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Nugent

customer_reviews.title: A solid design with terrible Hardware/Software
customer_reviews.text: The keyboard worked for a couple of weeks, then all of a sudden it started disconnecting and it's basically dead now, and apparently I'm not the only one with this issue, a quick Google search will show that this issue is common, and corsair are doing nothing about it. Very dissapointed, DO NOT BUY!
customer_reviews.author: Yousif

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money
customer_reviews.text: Its everything you've wanted but can't justify spending the money on. Make all your online buddies jealous with clicks so loud it triggers Discord's voice-activation. Irritate your co-workers with incessant clackity-clack. Open the blinds and make the neighbors think you bought a disco ball. It really is that bright and that loud. It costs so much that you'll think twice before smashing your fists through it. It'll bloody your hands if you do. Tons of light settings, integrates with my corsair headset. I caught it on sale around Black Friday and I'm really happy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Travis

customer_reviews.title: The best of the best out there!
customer_reviews.text: Not sure what other people mean by the CUE (Corsair Utility Engine) being a con. It's great and doesn't require much brain power to get used to like previously said about this utility program.. Now on to the keyboard, I think this is a perfect min/max between the normal K95 and K70 versions. Besides the 6 G keys, the media keys are better laid out (they are raised up, much better than the low barely rounded ones from previous versions in my opinion.) Also, the Corsair logo and the top rim are RGB as well (programmable) and that is awesome! I couldn't ask for a better keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: TIMOTHY

customer_reviews.title: Best keyboard I've ever had
customer_reviews.text: Got mine with the MX browns for my home gaming PC and It's the best keyboard I've ever had. I love the magnetic and flipable wrist rest surface. Everything on this bad boy is top quality. The only downside is every other keyboard I use feels like garbage now. I had to buy a cheaper mechanical keyboard to upgrade my company supplied work computer that I only use occasionally between jobs just so I don't feel the urge to rage quit when I'm typing after getting used to the elite feel of the K95.
customer_reviews.author: Th3PwnyExpress

customer_reviews.title: Warning !!! H100i V2 Owners ICue Soft Still Has Many issues
customer_reviews.text: If you use the H100i V2 using their "Link" software there may be issues with the "ICUE" software. (High Temps, Wrong Temp Readings, etc...) Also if you use ANY monitoring software (HWinfo, PCMeter, CoreTemp, ETC...) you will be forced to uninstall them if you want ICUE to work. Along with the many, many other issues reported by lotts of other users, ICUE Does NOT play with other software very well at all. And the keyboard isn't all that, as others might say. Just be prepared for problems. Unless your one of the lucky ones.
customer_reviews.author: K. Smith

customer_reviews.title: One Great Keyboard - nothing better exists
customer_reviews.text: I bought this from Amazon after using 3 different Razor Keyboards that just sucked, no service from Razor, their web site is always down. Every time I emailed them about the problems. They answer was we will get back to you, we are working on a fix. That went on for 2 years. There are hundreds of complaints about the same issue on Google. I had enough, so after 2 years I bought this Corsair, I've had it for almost a year and no complaints. it's the best Gaming Keyboard I have ever owned. All my friends have bought one to and they love it.
customer_reviews.author: D. Abbott

customer_reviews.title: Amazing keyboard!!!
customer_reviews.text: This keyboard is just great, the way it feels, and these speed switches are just amazing. Even if you don't game, this has been the best keyboard I have ever owned. It really can help you type faster and more comfortably. It takes a little bit to get used to, I would sometimes find myself hitting multiple keys I didn't mean to hit, I think because of the sensitivity and because they are raised. After a while you will get used to it though and its amazing. It does get dirty easily though, so if you want the thing looking pristine all the time you might want a keyboard vacuum or something.
customer_reviews.author: Francis

customer_reviews.title: Corsair keyboard
customer_reviews.text: I have alot of issues with this keyboard the spacebar is broken and the legs of the keyboard are weak and break easliy I already changed like 3 spacebar and even took spacebar from my older keyboard to fix the issue the Windows key also broke after 2 weeks of use this keyboard is very expensive but not durable for long time only if you tap on keys very gently. Other keyboards I used in the past even cheaper and I had no issues with them but this one it does
customer_reviews.author: Parelem

customer_reviews.title: Very  good keyboard, however
customer_reviews.text: I'm an angry gamer so I must have smacked this one too many timeswhich may have damaged the switch on my spacebar. That aside, as long as i've had this and if I didn't hit it a lot, I would have no doubt inmymind that this keyboardwouldbe a fantastic additiontoa gaming setup. Only con I can thinkofat this point would be I don't like that it uses 2 USB ports If you payed attention to this review, you will notice some double spacesor lack there of.I typed this reviewup onthis keyboard to show my struggles LMAO. anyways good quality but if you hit the keyboard a good amout of times (shhhhhhh) the switches will get damaged.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler

customer_reviews.title: Excellent keyboard! Better than Logitech G910!
customer_reviews.text: Very fast and highly customizable keyboard! RGB lighting is gorgeous and build quality very high! When paired with a Corsai Nightsword mouse, my kills went up in COD MW 2019. The 1.2 ms cherry MX keys are way faster than the G910. Had a 156 kill game in Shipment and 102 kill game in Rust. Build wuality is excellent and the keys for WASD are swapable for a better gaming experience. Bye, bye Logitech!
customer_reviews.author: NYCinCA

customer_reviews.title: The Best i've i had yet
customer_reviews.text: short review: this keyboard is what i chose to replace my logitec g710+ blue keyboard and i must say im soooooo glad i went with the k95 platinum speed's. I was afraid i wouldn't like it as much because the speed switches aren't as clicky but they sound great and so much easier to press so that means typing faster easier !!!. also it has endless rgb support and also has macro's of course. it comes with a great wrist rest also that's rubber. also the keyboard will link with other corsair products with the rgb lights!! 100/100 i highly recommend this keyboard for typist and gamers alike it's worth every penny
customer_reviews.author: john

customer_reviews.title: Who Knew
customer_reviews.text: How many keyboards have I gone thru....lets just say way too many, but at last I have met the final candidate and I'm happy to say, they won, hands down, this keyboard is amazing, besides the lighting effects, the soft click of the keys, the design, this is a work of art. The pass thru USB...BONUS...onboard volume wheel, real smooth. Button to change profiles on the fly, turn of the WINDOWS HOT KEY ( so it does not activate by mistake while gaming ) great feature by the way. Also can change brightness as well...........
customer_reviews.author: Steven Lewis

customer_reviews.title: Near perfect, buying another two or three. GREAT key feel.
customer_reviews.text: It is a near prefect keyboard. It needs a USB 3.0 port. I bought the red keys, not the brown version. Feels great. Software is easy-ish, lots more to learn. CON: this may seem laughable, but the stock ‘swirl’ pattern made me motion sick. It took a few moments to get the kb stable (fixed color for today), and I had to walk away for a few hours. Keys feel great. Key’s are very easy to read. Wrist pad works well. Software is okay, 8/10. But I might buy a second or third one, so darned good.
customer_reviews.author: WM173

customer_reviews.title: Great keyboard to look at late at night
customer_reviews.text: Keyboard, Mouse pad and Mouse all light up well. Works as designed; however, as a touch typist, the keystrokes are large and overly tactile. Lots of keystroke errors are the result. If you're gaming that fast response might be what you want, but lower pad keyboards are faster (for typing) at least for me (at about 60 words a minute). Editing time is increased to a high level. Purchasing a different keyboard for data input; but keeping this one for wow factor. Love the programmable effects and Corsair updates the software frequently. High quality? Yes it is. Great colors? Yes. Very Cool!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Michael J S

customer_reviews.title: So far so good I am impressed.
customer_reviews.text: I been searching around for a really good with quality gaming keyboard when I came across K95. The keyboard feels solid and the mechanical feeling is unbeatable. One downside on the keyboard is that the White LED at full brightness isn't that bright. I was hoping for a brighter one to complement my set up. The extra key on the left side are good for Macros. So far I own about 3 Items from corsair and it is good. One thing I hope to try is the Wireless Rbg pro gaming headset. Hopefully Corsair can sponsor me with one. I am becoming a Fan of Corsair.
customer_reviews.author: Amador

customer_reviews.title: Keyboard support tab to lift it broke just by sliding it over my corsair mouse pad.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased March 15 of 2019. Really nice keyboard. Dont think I could be more happier. Just one small problem. The little stand offs to tilt your keyboard are made of plastic. Sliding my keyboard over my corsair Matt broke one. So be careful not to slide your keyboard around or you will have to prop it up with something or just deal with it and have it lay flat. Not sure if corsair sales replacements for it. Dont really want to rma and be without just for a plastic tab.
customer_reviews.author: Miguel A. Hernandez

customer_reviews.title: No physical manual in box
customer_reviews.text: The reason for the 3 stars is: First; there is no manual for the initial set up for the key board, or any of its settings in the box. There is only the online YouTube videos that explain some of what you need to know. Second; the sensitivity of the keys is far to light (by default), and you could end up double taping a key very easily. To make matters worse, there is no information that I could find to adjust the sensitivity (not even a you tube video). Other than those things it is a good key board, and worth the money even with the inconveniences.
customer_reviews.author: James Schuman

customer_reviews.title: Need some time to get used with its keys. Beware!
customer_reviews.text: It's not your regular plastic body keyboard. Despite having great build, the keys are just responsive as well as any cherry mx key strokes. I like the extra attention to textures on the space bar as well. However, the gaps between keys are too small that and I found myself making a lot of spelling errors while typing on it especially the letter "A" and "Cap lock" keys. Otherwise, it's a sturdy keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: Yee Chua

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: Built well. Typing took a little to get used to. I'm not sure but the key setup feels a little different to other keyboards. Possibly smaller keys? The RGB is looks great. Volume wheel and media controls are great. Would have liked a version without the macro keys since I never use them. I have not used the software much but it seems to work well enough when I played around with it
customer_reviews.author: BT

customer_reviews.title: Very nice, Cherry MX Browns are a little loose and plastiky (orings then added), software is a little quirky
customer_reviews.text: Very nice, but I was surprised that the Cherry MX brown switches felt and sounded a little more loose and plastiky than I expected. I added Rosewill O-rings, and that improved the feel and sound nicely. The F and J "home keys" are a little hard to find by feel, so I am experimenting with changing those keys to some with a tactile surface. My temporary fix for this is by using the included textured F and S keys. The Corsair "Cue" software is a little quirky, but it does allow many nice lighting options. The personal / emotional feel that this lighted keyboard extends from the new PC is very nice and satisfying.
customer_reviews.author: AverageNiceGuy

customer_reviews.title: Buggy, but solid.
customer_reviews.text: The software has sucked for years, it's improving but man is it annoying sometimes to deal with. The switches are nice, the hardware profiles are limited though, they only allow one lighting effect per profile and sometimes the profile switching button is buggy, it took a lot of hub-bub to get it to even let me save hardware profiles, also it only let's you save keystroke to the macros for hardware profiles (onboard) I'd imagine both of thouse are because it has limited memory in the unit itself. Overall I'd give it a 3, but I got it on sale and I was able to fix my issues. So 4 stars it is.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis

customer_reviews.title: Speed keys are amazing.
customer_reviews.text: I have seen a lot of people say that the speed keys are hard to get used too. I'm coming from the K65 (I believe) Brown Cherry keys and have almost instantly adapted to this K95 keyboard. The keys react on little down-force compared to my previous keyboard and are great for gaming. The RGB is amazing and with the iCue Software and downloadable profiles you can instantly match games and change your whole RGB setup (as-long as they are Corsair). The keyboard is my favorite RGB part as it can get very bright and can display so many different types of colors.
customer_reviews.author: SLYSANITY

customer_reviews.title: Was good for a few months, but quality seems to be meh
customer_reviews.text: For the first few months this keyboard was amazing. The lighting is great and easy to adjust in the ICUE. The macro keys are nice too with the grey caps. I really enjoyed this keyboard for the first couple months I've had it. It's been 6 months now and the space bar isn't working correctly, key's often pop off and the feel of the keys have become very janky. I dust the keyboard with air cans every other week but it still acts up. I'm pretty disappointed in the quality of this product.
customer_reviews.author: Tesh Patel

customer_reviews.title: Worked perfectly for just under one year. Now useless.
customer_reviews.text: This keyboard was pretty good. I liked having the macros on it and typing felt pretty good. The issue is that I've had it for just under one year and the space bar is essentially useless. It gets stuck and sometimes doesn't go down enough to register. You kinda need a space bar to type anything and play most games so... I can't use this anymore for anything. I kinda feel like I got ripped off. Shame since I really like Corsair; usually their products are great.
customer_reviews.author: Luis Camarena

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Keyboard
customer_reviews.text: I love this keyboard. The macro settings for it are excellent and its easy to record and set them up. The keyboard itself has a great feel to it. And its easy to take apart and clean when you want to, comes with the little key puller and some extra keys with a different grip for your w, a, s, & d as well as some for q, e, r, and f. Never had much problems with it and have even bought another one for my wife.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: This is a great keyboard. Response time is very quick. Keys have a great feel and do not need to be pushed very hard or far. The iCue software is very user friendly. It has customizable keys. You will have this up and running with the colors you like in a very short time. Highly recommended for any PC gamers. When they say it has a clicky noise, they are not kidding. It can be loud if your room is quiet, but I do not hear it over the sounds of my speakers while playing games or watching movies.
customer_reviews.author: Gabriel S.

customer_reviews.title: Best for gamers , amazing product, worth every penny
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this for my son who’s 14 and an a big Gamer and he loved it ! Worth every penny and wants another one for our second property. He plays games where keystrokes count and his performance has greatly improved with high quality keys , no stick , faster reaction times and more !! If your going to invest in a long last gaming product this is the best .
customer_reviews.author: TCoonan

customer_reviews.title: Highest quality and great features
customer_reviews.text: Excellent build quality. At $140, it is unquestionably a great value and doesn't have any competition. At the original $200 price point its a tough sell compared to the Huntsman Elite. The MXBrown switches have a great tactile feel that is great for typing while sacrificing very little for gaming. Wrist support and the keyboard are very rigid. The only drawback so far is how quickly the wrist support shows dirt.
customer_reviews.author: PatrickP

customer_reviews.title: Butta Keyboard
customer_reviews.text: I bought a refurbished Cherry MX. I was very happy with the value that I received for this magnificant keyboard. The keyboard action makes typing a pleaure. I found the wrist support comfortable; the key action like "butta"--smooth, accurate, great feedback, and a kaleidoscopic LED lighting that will makes it a "fun" keyboard. Be sure to download the manual and the CUE interface. Loved that it had a pass through USB which I promptly used for my mouse. Really great quality and outstanding visual and tactile user experience.
customer_reviews.author: Leisa

customer_reviews.title: Great Build quality.
customer_reviews.text: Upgraded from a 3 year old Corsair K70. Has great build quality and feels sturdy. The wrist rest is comfortable and the padding feels amazing. Keys are responsive , not too quiet nor too loud. I know a lot of people gripe over having to use Icue , but personally I’ve never had issues with it and the lighting on this keyboard is no exception.
customer_reviews.author: Jeigermeister

customer_reviews.title: Super Fast Keyboard
customer_reviews.text: This is a great keyboard. I got the one with the most sensitive action capabilities (the silver) because I am a very quick typist and thought this would help my typing speed. It does help me type fast; however, if I were to do it again, I would get a less sensitive one (the red) because I keep adding letters when I type and have to constantly go back and edit them out. Even the lightest touch of my fingers resting on the keys causes the letters to type. Also, the keys are backlit and out of the box were programmed with this oscillating rainbow pattern that is so pretty to watch.
customer_reviews.author: Hilkei

customer_reviews.title: Great keyboard but the macros are a letdown
customer_reviews.text: This keyboard is amazing. Unfortunately it's let down by the macro keys. Programming them with the software included is next to impossible which makes them effectively useless. I did notice that, out of habit, I kept hitting the wrong keys on that side of the keyboard simply because I expect the Esc key to be the top left most key. So, since the macro keys are worthless and thats the biggest difference between this and the K70, I returned it for that version.
customer_reviews.author: wg

customer_reviews.title: TYPING AND IN LOVE!
customer_reviews.text: This keyboard is silent but deadly perfect. Has the click you want, the assortment of 6 macro buttons you want, the cool lights you want (VERY CUSTOMIZABLE), the clickiness you crave, the sound control dial you swoon over, the super sexy light bar running along the top, and the comfortable and reversible palm rest. This keyboard has it all.... Literally no complaints just get it. Want a better pairing and love macros like me??? Pair it with a Corsair SCIMITAR PRO RGB Optical MOBA/MMO Gaming Mouse and you will truly be in heaven.
customer_reviews.author: Zachary O

customer_reviews.title: Amazing keyboard! Good for gaming.
customer_reviews.text: Coming from non mechanical keyboard I absolutely love this thing. The cherry keys are wonderful and react on a dime. The RGB are extremely bright and the wrist support is strong and good quality. Only thing I will say is dont rest your fingers on the keys or change out the wasd keys to another color as you barely put pressure on it and it will definitely register.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron

customer_reviews.title: It will stop working after 6 months
customer_reviews.text: The main reasons I purchased this keyboard was for the mechanical keys and the programmable keys. For the first 6-8 months of usage, it worked flawlessly. In the past few months, the keyboard randomly freezes and will not register any key inputs unless I unplug it and plug it back in. It does that about once an hour. Unfortunately my return and support window has closed through Amazon which is sad considering it hasn't even been a year yet. Very disappointed in the keyboard and support for it.
customer_reviews.author: Charlie

customer_reviews.title: I ddn't like this at all for the price I spent.
customer_reviews.text: The LEDs are dim, very dim compared to my Steel Series M800 but it was the only gaming keyboard I saw these days that have dedicated macro keys. I hated the key switches too. These are LOUD keys and require a longer press than I'm used to. For the money, I would have expected brighter LEDs and higher quality keys. Since I bought this, the price has come down though.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon User

customer_reviews.title: Excellent keyboard and high quality as expected from Corsair
customer_reviews.text: Excellent keyboard and high quality as expected from Corsair... Feels like the keyboards Razer first produced back when I bought my Razer Tarantula many years ago. (get it together razer!) Do take the time to read up on how to use this with usb3.0 or 2.0 configuration. Some motherboards don't have the correct type of usb3.0 ports and instead have usb3.0 charging ports which provide too much power for the keyboard. So you'll want to use two usb 2.0 ports instead but fear not as the keyboard does have a single pass through usb port on it as well so you can plug a mouse, or rgb mousepad directly into the keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: private

customer_reviews.title: Love everything about this
customer_reviews.text: Several options for programming hot keys, color & schemes, comfortable, has a softer mechanical feel to it versus loud clunky - feels much better on the fingers - and is amazing for gaming and long periods of work. I've bought 3, 1 for my gaming , 1 for my wife's gaming maching, and 1 for my home office - this is my go-to, period :)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: ... a software called iCUE that makes running macros very easy. It's a highly advanced software that can set ...
customer_reviews.text: Corsair has a software called iCUE that makes running macros very easy. It's a highly advanced software that can set repeatable macros with key presses and just holding the key down and you can set how many milliseconds of delay can occur between each action. I got this because I couldn't game properly on Blade and Soul and this helped solved fatigue, not that I recommend playing BnS because I actually quit. But best software on the market. And if you get the Corsair Glaive mouse you can use the software for the mouse too, if the keyboard macros aren't enough.
customer_reviews.author: Darrell Wong

customer_reviews.title: Great Keyboard but It disconnects after few minutes.
customer_reviews.text: I can get this to work but it only does so for about 5 mins and then it disconnects silently. Its a wide spread and well known error of some sort or defect. I tried to reset it and reinstall it and use powered USB hub and all ports. I tried just one USB plug and I installed iCue over and over. Corsair said replace it so thats what I am doing I guess. I love it but it dont stay working. My PC is brand new build. All software is updated etc.. Upon further investigation on Corsair forums this is well known and old error/defect.. I dont know just do your research first.
customer_reviews.author: Brad Les Bergeron

customer_reviews.title: Space Bar rocks like a see saw after 6 months of use
customer_reviews.text: I got this keyboard in Nov. 2018, it's literally 6 months old. The space bar has a cherry switch in the center, and two "cherry" connector stabilizers on the left and right side of the key. When I press on either left or right side of the space bar, the opposite side lifts up, and disconnects from the stabilizer. It happens while typing, I mostly use my right thumb to hit space, so when I do, the left side of the keycap lifts up, and even while pressing all the way down on the right side, the space key doesn't register a press. Very annoying. Seems like the keycap is just too cheaply made, and doesn't adhere to the stabilizer.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful keyboard
customer_reviews.text: Completely customizable, relating to the lighting and keybinding. You can make any key any color and you can set any key to do almost anything. From setting a key to execute another complicated string of self-recorded key presses, to just rebinding a key altogether, there's almost nothing you can't do with this keyboard. My one and only considerable complaint is that there's no sleep button. This keyboard has almost every button you could ever need EXCEPT a sleep button. If you don't care about a sleep button, then there's really nothing negative I can say about this keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: Blay T.

customer_reviews.title: Solid, high quality keyboard - Worthy of its hefty price tag
customer_reviews.text: I got on board with Corsair's RGB keyboards from day one with the K70 a few years ago, which was unfortunately much more frustrating than it should have been, constantly failing and needing to be reset or jimmied around with (and the software, OMG it was terrible when it first came out). But they got things right with their latest line of keyboards. The K95 is solid, and worth the premium cost. I love the replaceable MOBA keycaps that it comes with. And THANK YOU for including a tool so that I don't break my switches prying keycaps off by hand... that's what ultimately required a new purchase.
customer_reviews.author: wr

customer_reviews.title: Best Keyboard I've Ever Had
customer_reviews.text: Got this keyboard on sale. I don't regret my purchase whatsoever. The keyboard is heavy and sturdy and is greatly customizable. I have my keyboard waving a Canadien flag as I type this. The programmable keys are helpful, although I don't find myself using them to often. The media controls are solid and helpful as well. The iCUE customizer software is easy to use and has a boatload of features, so many that I probably haven't even seen them all. That said, the keyboard is AWFUL to clean. Not blaming Corsair for this though, as that's just how mechanical keyboards are. BUY THIS KEYBOARD!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan F.

customer_reviews.title: Best keyboard I've had to date.
customer_reviews.text: Best keyboard I've owned yet. Replaced another gaming keyboard from different company that used a bespoke switch. The Cherry MX Brown switch is just a delight to type on and the construction is simply incredible. The only thing that is a bit of a learning curve is the lighting software: runs a bit more like Photoshop using a layer system to add or change keys in small batches and a base layer for all or many keys. Also works with compatible mouse, which is also great. Very happy.
customer_reviews.author: M. Brown

customer_reviews.title: Great keyboard but lousy build quality as it is no longer working properly
customer_reviews.text: I bought this keyboard earlier this year and up until now I have loved it. Recently some of the buttons stopped responding, namely the escape key. I've worked with Corsair on RMA before but will not on this issue. I will not pay to send them their defective merchandise for replacement. BTW I have not mistreated this keyboard at all, in case you are wondering. I will be going back to using Razer products as I have a mouse and keyboard that I bought in 2008 that still work fine, I'm talking about the Razer Naga and Razer Anansi.
customer_reviews.author: DevilDogAK

customer_reviews.title: Great keyboard for business and gaming
customer_reviews.text: I have long missed the solid feel of a mechanical keyboard and like this very much. The illuminated keys are bright and clear. My only complaint is that the keys feel like they don't have enough spacing between each other; I'm a touch typist and am mis-firing on the keys. Perhaps my hands will get used to the spacing, it's otherwise a great product.
customer_reviews.author: L. J. Sachartoff

customer_reviews.title: Keyboards are Important
customer_reviews.text: before I purchased this keyboard I purchased a $70 keyboard from Red Dragon. I was very unhappy with the cheap feeling and the squished feeling of the keys. when this keyboard came in it was a breath of fresh air! It feels premium, it is very fast and accurate. I primarily use this keyboard for coding which requires a lot of typing and so far I am very happy with my purchase. I learned that keyboards are a very important part of the computer, because it is one of the key elements that you interact with the most! dont cheap out get something good!
customer_reviews.author: Brandon Church

customer_reviews.title: Great Keyboard
customer_reviews.text: Keys are a little softer than I'm used to, and the click is a little quieter than what you'll find in a Razer keyboard. The colors are FANTASTIC, and the only real downside is that the keyboard doesn't have any headphone/mic ports. The extra WASDQER keys with sculpted, angled face were a nice addition. Also comes with a key puller. The volume wheel and mute button are also a nice feature that I find myself using more than I thought I would.
customer_reviews.author: R. Burk

customer_reviews.title: After researching for a gaming board this is my choice
customer_reviews.text: This is a great keyboard, improved from the previous K95 with 15 G keys. The palm rest is more comfortable, 2 sides, easier to clean. Included some extra keys that are extra durable and slanted for easier use in games. Cons: The keys tend to show wear for me, so I bought the PBT double shot keys for $50. More durable and don't show the wear. A rough surface to help grip better which I like. Too bad these weren't standard, for a $200 keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: Ari Levine

customer_reviews.title: Great, high quality keyboard, matches all the other twinkely Corsair stuff I have...which is fun.
customer_reviews.text: Love it. Great keyboard, screams quality. The lighting feature so appeals to my inner 12 year old. I love walking into my home office and seeing the light show of all my Corsair components. Two issues...it is expensive. And what is with the reversed labeling for the shifted items? All the "shift characters" are on the *bottom* of the key and are almost the same size as the unshifted character, which is different from every other QWERTY keyboard I have ever owned. Some conventions are good, Corsair!
customer_reviews.author: AndyW

customer_reviews.title: E key sticks. Terrible build quality.
customer_reviews.text: Well that was a short love affair. None of the premium features matter if you don't have reliability. Thee E key sporadically sticks -- frequeeeently enough (seeee?) that it will inteeerrupt passwords and makee you have to edit every other word. I wouldn't reccomment a Corsair keyboard. My first K90 had a third of its LED's die, and now this. Go buy something reeliable.
customer_reviews.author: Amazonian

customer_reviews.title: Great keyboard, BIG though
customer_reviews.text: The keyboard wouldn't work, it looked fantastic and all the cool features worked but I couldn't get it to work (something wrong with my order). Would've just replaced it, but I needed a tenkeyless, as this keyboard was also a little too large for me to keep my nice aluminum mousepad.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Would not order again
customer_reviews.text: The keyboard is functional. The lighting options are, to say the least, unique. I don't game. The keycaps have the shift characters and the non-shift characters swapped - different than any keyboard I've ever used since 1962. Annoying. The macro keys on the left side are functional. But when I am looking at the screen and reaching for the ESC in the upper left position, I end up hitting the G1 macro key. Annoying. If I had this keyboard at all of my workstations, then I would get used to it eventually. But I don't and I won"t.
customer_reviews.author: Rick Holmes

customer_reviews.title: Best keyboard ever!
customer_reviews.text: This is by far for me atleast the best keyboard, it feels well built and comfortable. I enjoy the clicky noises the keyboard produces and feel this keyboard makes me faster when it comes to gaming. The keys aren’t slippery, the keys are light, and the rgb is so cool. I can play for hours and still feel comfortable because of how well built this product really is. All in all, the product is well worth it!
customer_reviews.author: Alexander Swander

customer_reviews.title: Would be 5* if not for the font
customer_reviews.text: Corsair appears to have recently changed the font on their keyboards and it is very... childish - for lack of a better word. I tried looking for older models of their keyboards with the previous font but they all cost the same so it didn't make much sense to do that. That said, mechanical keyboards are a life changer if you don't have one already (trust me, I used to tell myself it wasn't worth the money. It is.). This is still a very great quality keyboard in spite of the issues I have with the font and would still recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Fae

customer_reviews.title: The Keyboard I always wanted
customer_reviews.text: Wow! I went from a Logitech G910 Keyboard to this! What a difference! Is it worth the money? YER DERN TOOTIN'! This keyboard is exactly what I've been looking for for years. It's a bit heavy (LIKE!!!) and it doesn't move or slide. VERY easy to clean out! The LED configuration software is easy to set up, so you can highlight whatever keys you want or just create a cool pattern. This thing is built to last! Thank you Corsair for getting it right!
customer_reviews.author: Hans C.

customer_reviews.title: it is absolutely amazing! Learning the software needed just to make it ...
customer_reviews.text: They went all out for this keyboard, it is absolutely amazing! Learning the software needed just to make it stay a solid color was more complicated than just pressing a button, but it can do anything you want it to just about. The software is self explanatory but if you want to make certain keys the same color (including all of them) you click and drag on the picture which ones you are applying that color to, just choosing a color with no keys selected will make the keyboard appear to not be working.
customer_reviews.author: Supercalifragilisticexpealidocious

customer_reviews.title: Too big, loud, and to get the rgb to turn white is nearly impossible.
customer_reviews.text: The Red Cherry is really loud, and the keyboard is huge. I returned after a couple of days, and got a K70 to eliminate the G keys on the left that I will never use. RGB is very bright, but impossible to get a clean 5000k white on the keyboard. It's either too red, or green. As far as for gaming it's amazing.
customer_reviews.author: GonzaloTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Keyboard for a really great price
customer_reviews.text: I finally replaced my MXBlueCherry Black Widow Ultimate from 2009 with this Keyboard, and I couldn't be happier. As much as I enjoy the auditory feed back blues give, Brown Cherry Switches give just enough that it still sounds good when gaming and typing to help your flow. My wife no longer can hear me type from across the house when I am typing a novel or gaming heavily. The palm/wrist rests are fantastic, the curved keys from WASD and QERF really help for gaming, not to mention giving your fingers new homes to memorize in terms of typing. Recommend this keyboard to anyone looking to get a mechanical keyboard for their gaming or typing needs.
customer_reviews.author: F0X7713

customer_reviews.title: Price pays off the quality
customer_reviews.text: Excellent keyboard with for its quality and price. I'm a hardcore PC gamer that requires a lot of keytap pressing and smashing. I don't have to replace my keytaps every month like how I did with my old Logitech mechanical gaming keyboard because of how strong and sturdy the keytaps are on this mechanical keyboard. The built in macro to play around/switch the bright colors is really easy to use and a fast + easy installation setup for it too on your Desktop.
customer_reviews.author: Qiyana

customer_reviews.title: Replacing because of terrible iCUE software
customer_reviews.text: I like everything about this keyboard, from the font on the keys, to the LEDs, to the overall build quality and size. I am replacing this keyboard because the iCUE software is absolutely horrendous, it doesn't auto start anymore, random crashes and errors, and doesn't let me save lighting profiles to the keyboard. Another problem that I've had in the past is the LEDs failing, and fading to a reddish pink. I really want to keep this keyboard but just can't stand the iCUE software
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas D.

customer_reviews.title: Looks nice feels nice but a bit loud.
customer_reviews.text: The keyboard is decent. The build quality is average. The lights are pretty bright and you have a lot of customization. The keys seem to be pretty loud a lot louder than other brands. Overall the keyboard is decent for the price and it is comfortable with the large wrist wrest.
customer_reviews.author: Georgio

customer_reviews.title: Solid
customer_reviews.text: The best Corsair keyboard as shown by the price. I got this on sale for $150, but now I see it dropping as low as $120. The dedicated macro keys are very useful, and the Cherry MX Speed switches have a very nice feel to them. However the rest is embarrassed by the plush wrist rest Razer has to offer, and I feel for its price, the RGB should be a bit brighter. Overall, a solid keyboard, and if the price is as low as it is now, snatch it.
customer_reviews.author: Kim Jong Uno

customer_reviews.title: Buttons stick and keyboard randomly stops working
customer_reviews.text: Had my keyboard for over a year.. Everything was fine until my left Ctrl button started to stick.. Also I had to unplug and plug the cords back into my computer to punch in my password to get to the desktop. Sometimes I have to restart my computer to get the keyboard to even light up. Very Disappointed in Corsair. Im also disappointed in their other products as well.
customer_reviews.author: Cody Pudlish

customer_reviews.title: Always a great product from them, but....
customer_reviews.text: I have always loved their keyboards and this is my third, but this one has issues. In the heat of battle for FPS I have an issue when pressing keys real fast and releasing them makes the key itself pop off. Not good in the middle of a raid or doing some fast key switching. But I love the matching RGB to the mouse and wireless headphones. :)
customer_reviews.author: Mykle D. Williams

customer_reviews.title: Great mechanical keyboard
customer_reviews.text: Response is excellent. Full RGB is very bright. Only complaint is the bulky USB cable - super fat and hard to route. Much thicker than any keyboard I have every owned or used. Possible due to the USB passthruogh - which I dont even use. Otherwise great keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: Richard D

customer_reviews.title: Super sensitive keyboard
customer_reviews.text: When I went shopping for a new keyboard, I wanted mechanical, sensitive keys, macro support, and RGB. I got it all with this keyboard. When typing papers for school, or just chatting on the web, I've noticed that I've had to do the "hover hands" on my keyboard, because the "j" key will find it's way into my text with the weight of my finger resting on it. Other keys have a similar issue, because the sensitivity of the keyboard is at a 10. Not a bad thing though.
customer_reviews.author: Shane Stevenson

customer_reviews.title: The keys are extremely sensitive, but it’s a great keyboard!
customer_reviews.text: I like the keyboard a lot, but the keys are VERY sensitive. Like, too sensitive. I guess that is preference, though. I came from Logitech G series keyboards, and this is my first Corsair. I know you can change the key weights, but the Logitech is my choice out of the two. I like the look of this Corsair much better though, and it’s still a great keyboard. I will get used to the sensitivity in time.
customer_reviews.author: Karter

customer_reviews.title: Highly Rated for a Reason
customer_reviews.text: A year later, this keyboard still functions and looks brand new after heavy daily use. The Cherry MX switches provide a lot of customization potential in terms of keycaps. The iCue software is clunky, but if you put some time into it, you can get pretty much any RGB functionality you want. The macro capability is there, too.
customer_reviews.author: Z Fox

customer_reviews.title: The brushed aluminum is so beautiful and the feel is very premium
customer_reviews.text: I really really wanted to keep this one and was looking for reasons to not return. The brushed aluminum is so beautiful and the feel is very premium. However, extremely disappointed that cherry blues are not available and the wrist rest is, ummm useless for my taste. The font does give it a fuzzy look and the letters do not seem as clear when compared to the blackwidow. Macro software not user-friendly. Again, beautiful keyboard but not practical for my use.
customer_reviews.author: Tiffany L

customer_reviews.title: It's buggy.  Volume controls go haywire
customer_reviews.text: Constant issue I have with this keyboard is that the volume will either continuously turn up or down, and you can't stop it unless you unplug the keyboard and plug it back in. Starting to be a real pain.
customer_reviews.author: Kyosji

customer_reviews.title: Good Keyboard, but Terrible Software
customer_reviews.text: Overall it is a good keyboard, but it does not function properly. If you intend to use the macro keys or lighting effects at all, you will need to install iCUE, the Corsair software for their products. Unfortunately this software will gut your FPS on most modern games (I know it makes no sense that it would, but it does, just search iCUE frame drops) and I am dealing with an unresolved issue where the software no longer recognizes this keyboard, but recognizes all of my other devices. Extremely frustrating, I highly recommend a different brand to avoid iCUE all together.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen

customer_reviews.title: Not for my gaming needs
customer_reviews.text: I play FPS games and I found that if I move really fast along the keys the key caps will come off. They are not mounted secure and come off very easy. The RGB lighting is bright and very nice, the keys are not as loud as I expected and is decent. If it weren't for the key caps flying off during game play I would be super happy
customer_reviews.author: Do|eMite

customer_reviews.title: Great keyboard in theory, garbage quality control in reality
customer_reviews.text: This is my second k95 in 3 days, corsair has major issues with their volume wheel on both boards, and random red RGB LEDS out on several keys. One key even lights up the wrong key when pressed. I am on the latest iCue software with the latest firmware, so I'm reasonably confident this is a hardware issue. Furthermore, the switches feel quite inconsistently weighted (browns) and makes for an overall crappy typing experience. I'm also experiencing some double presses from they keyboard and will be returning it for a huntsman or something along those lines.
customer_reviews.author: Ben Huth

customer_reviews.title: Quality Keyboard
customer_reviews.text: Great keys and comes with textured gaming keys , the customization is cool and works great with games with the cherry mx keys , keys are kinda clicky which I like but they’re not super clicky and not super quiet , great middle ground. Happy with my purchase
customer_reviews.author: Mike S

customer_reviews.title: My favorite keyboard.
customer_reviews.text: It's shorter to list the things I dislike about this keyboard because almost everything is excellent. The only two complaints I have are that there is only 1 USB passthrough (my DasKeyboard 4 had 2), and the cable is non removable. Here's a few standout positives: typing feel, RGB customization, build quality (I LOVE the brushed aluminum), braided cable, media controls. It's a bit pricey, but HIGHLY recommended.
customer_reviews.author: acondie13

customer_reviews.title: Ok, but the space bar sometimes messes up and slips and some keys double enter.
customer_reviews.text: Given the price, this is just an OK keyboard with some of the issues it has. The spacebar sometimes needs to be re sat back into place because it slips off track and then stops working till adjusted, and some of the keys end up being overly sensitive and get pressed more than once. The keys are also pretty loud, but I think that is by design so I didn't take that into consideration with the store. The spacebar issue is the problem that really drives me up the wall.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew

product_meta.title: Corsair K95 RGB PLATINUM Mechanical Gaming Keyboard - 6x Programmable Macro Keys - USB Passthrough & Media Controls - Fastest Cherry MX Speed - RGB LED Backlit - Aluminum Finish
product_meta.description: Style:MX Speed| Color:GunmetalCorsair K95 RGB Platinum features Cherry MX Speed key switches backed by a lightweight aluminum frame. 8MB profile storage with hardware macro and lighting playback enable profile access independent of external software. Utilize the 19-zone light edge to add to dramatic animations and effects. Take advantage of the 6 programmable G-keys for in-game macros. Keyboard CUE Software - Supported in iCUE
feature_bullets: Aircraft grade anodized brushed aluminum frame: Built to withstand a lifetime of gaming. Lightweight and rugged durability, necessary for a keyboard that's going to see a lot of action

8MB profile storage with hardware macro and lighting playback: Allow access up to three stored profiles on the go, independent of external software. Wrist Rest: Full length, detachable, dual sided with soft touch finish. The keyboard report rate is 1000 Hz
Dynamic multicolor per key backlighting with Light Edge: Adjust each key's color and illumination level in addition to 19 zones on the top edge light bar for sophisticated and dramatic animations
6 programmable G keys for in game macros: Assign single keystrokes or complex multi key combos to any of the 6 dedicated macro keys

100% CHERRY MX Speed RGB mechanical key switches: Unleash blistering speed with the 1.2mm actuation and durability of gold contact CHERRY MX mechanical key switches. PC with 2 USB 2.0 ports Windows 10, Windows 8, Windows 7, or Windows Vista An internet connection is required to download the Corsair Utility Engine software

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars2,766 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
